description.narrative: The project objective is to develop cost effective and sustainable environmental rehabilitation and management of forest landsandas sociated rangelands, with a focus on the Irtysh pine forest, the dry Aral Seabed, and saxaul rangelands.

participating-org.narrative: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development
International Bank for Reconstruction and Development
Ministry of Agriculture's Forest and Hunting Committee (renamed to Forest and Wildlife Committee)

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :GA Schedule 4 para 9 | Description :An operational manual acceptable to the Bank for the competitive grantsprogram will be approved by the Grant Fund Board | Due Date :15-Dec-2007
Finance Agreement :LA Schedule 5 para 7 | Description :A framework for the pilot Participatory Forest Management activities in theIrtysh pine forests will be developed | Due Date :15-Dec-2008

Finance Agreement :LA Schedule 5 para 8 | Description :. Appropriate sites for the demonstrations will be proposed and the initialpolicy framework for the provision of long term use rights will be developed | Due Date :15-Jun-2008
Finance Agreement :Schedule 5 para 9 | Description :Government shall provide radionuclide study and followup as indicated | DueDate :31-Dec-2006

title.narrative: Component IIA: Cumulative area of dry Aral Seabed planted (#000 ha); Survival rate; Cost/ha (US$); Cumulative area direct seeded (#000 ha)

baseline.value: 0 ha area seabed planted; 25% survival rate; $207/ha cost of replanting; 0 ha direct seeded

target.value: 52,000 ha planted; >25% survival rate; <$175/ha cost of planting; 9,000 ha direct seeded

actual.value: Target surpassed. About 52,000 ha planted, including local akimats supporting rehabilitation and planting with equipment procuredusing project funds; 27.6% survival rate; $67/ha cost of planting; 9,400 ha direct seeded.

title.narrative: Component IA: Cumulative area of Irtysh pine replanted under project (#000 ha); Survival rate; Cost/ha (US$); Cumulative area of Irtysh pine direct seeded (#000 ha)

baseline.value: 0 ha replanted;30% survival rate;$240/ha cost of reforestation; 0 ha direct seeded

target.value: 41,000 ha reforested; 55% survival rate: <$190/ha reforestation cost; 2 ha direct seeded

actual.value: Target surpassed. 46,000 ha replanted; 60% survival rate; Cost of reforestation < $190 in real terms; 2 ha direct seeded.

title.narrative: Component IIB: Cumulative area of participatory saxaul rangeland restoration demonstrations initiated (#000 ha); Cumulative numberof ha with improved access to water for livestock (#000)

baseline.value: 0 ha with participatory rangeland restoration demonstrations; 0 ha withimproved access to water for livestock

target.value: 4,000 ha where rangeland demonstrations initiated; 168,000 ha with improved access to water for livestock

actual.value: Target surpassed. 6,000 ha where rangeland demonstrations initiated; 168,000 ha with improved access to water for livestock.

title.narrative: Component IIIB: # of grants approved and under implementation
Public support & sustainability increased as indicated by increased employment levels & other benefits to local poor.

target.value: 3,000 seasonally employed in Irtysh pine forest, 2,000 in Dry Aral Seabed, and 1,500 in saxaul rangelands

actual.value: Target achieved. 3,000 seasonally employed in Irtysh pine forest, 2,600 in Dry Aral Seabed, and 1,480 in saxaul rangelands.

title.narrative: Component IB: % fire management investments implemented in accordance with annual workplan

actual.value: Target achieved. 650,000 ha under improved fire management.

title.narrative: Government makes decisions to scale up programs and reflect this in future investment plans.

baseline.value: Insufficient knowledge of performance, costs, and impacts to justify large scale program

target.value: Post project replication plans to restore Irtysh forest and Dry Aral Seabed along lines of indicative 2025 vision, replicatesaxaulrangeland program, and apply lessons from grant subprojects

actual.value: Target achieved. Government plans to scale-up project achievements in rehabilitation of the Dry Aral Seabed and Irtysh Pine Forest,forest fire protection, and participatory forest management.

title.narrative: Studies, policies and expenditures reflect improved knowledge of resource dynamics and management, policy development, and capacityfor results oriented public expenditure on forest lands

baseline.value: Little information and analysis of dynamics, policy development, or results oriented public expenditure

target.value: Studies, policies and expenditures reflect improved knowledge of natural resource and forest fire management, policy development,and capacity for cost effective and results oriented public expenditure

actual.value: Target achieved. Through various planting techniques trialed, as well as studies conducted, during implementation the mostsustainable and cost effective planting methods are now being employed and a state-of-the-art FFCIS has been developed and is underimplementation.

title.narrative: Component IIIC: Project management ensures project implementation timeliness in accordance with annual workplan agreed with Bank

target.value: Completion on schedule (after adjustment if required to take into account effectiveness delays)

actual.value: Target achieved. Project management is satisfactory and project has been implemented in accordance with updated procurement planand implementation schedule.

title.narrative: Component IIIA: Improvements implemented in accordance with annual workplan

actual.value: Target achieved. Training program and study tours have been implemented according to annual procurement plan and schedule. Inaddition, procurement improvements have been implemented in accordance with recent procurement assessment.

title.narrative: Component 1C: Forest Partnership Development program designed and piloted

target.value: PFM operational in 4 villages and expanded to 12 additional villages.

actual.value: Target achieved. PFM program operational in 16 villages. Program has been assessed via PSIA Grant, with findings to support PFMprogram's scale-up.

title.narrative: Project reputation for integrity and public support for improved forest and associated rangeland management as reflected in public opinion surveys

baseline.value: Survey conducted in 2004 did not include public opinion poll on project, given that project was just beginning.

target.value: Improving trend in reputation for integrity and public support

actual.value: Target achieved. While a public opinion survey was not conducted at mid-term, an opinion survey was completed closer to projectcompletion (in September 2014). According to the survey results, respondents gave a high assessment to the efficiency of Projectactivities. The majority of surveyed villagers evaluated Project events as very efficient or somewhat efficient. Respondents alsoconsidered the quality and level of forestry management to have improved over the past ten years.

title.narrative: Area in ha of land where degradation is prevented, reduced or ameliorated.

baseline.value: Total degraded area covers 180,000 ha of Irtysh pine forest and 2.2 million ha of dry Aral Seabed. Improved management needed inSaxaul rangelands

target.value: 41,000 ha of Irtysh pine forest rehabilitated and reversal of fire degradation; 61,000 ha of Dry Aral Seabed covered by vegetation;and good management of 168,000 ha of saxaul rangelands

actual.value: Target surpassed. About 46,000 ha of Irtysh Pine rehabilitated; about 61,000 ha in Dry Aral Seabed covered by vegetation; and goodmanagement of 168,000 ha of saxaul rangelands.

title.narrative: DO indicators also apply to GEO
